title: Instructional Design Strategies for Optimal Timing Selection in Demonstration-Based Training

context.prior_knowledge: Demonstrated experiential learning and basic comprehension of instructional techniques
context.additional_context: Social sector education focused on applying information theory and instructional design-based metrics for optimal viewpoint selection in multi-camera environments

learning_goals: Learners can describe three or more objective metrics for selecting optimal demonstration timings in multi-camera streams.
Learners can apply viewpoint selection strategies combining information-theoretic measures (viewpoint entropy) and instructional design elements (face/hand visibility) to project design.
Learners can evaluate the educational effectiveness of demonstration videos filmed in limited technical environments (smartphone-based).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
